decks.notes: Utilize artifact synergies and disruptive elements to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently. The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal while also setting up powerful combos with cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Karn, the Great Creator. Narset, Parter of Veils and Chalice of the Void are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch provide additional card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and control the game early on.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and accelerants like Lion's Eye Diamond to storm off and cast a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Grapeshot. Using efficient cantrips like Brainstorm and Preordain, the deck digs through its library to find the necessary combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize and Duress. The inclusion of Wishclaw Talisman provides additional tutor options and enables the deck to find key combo pieces more consistently. By efficiently generating mana and drawing cards, this deck aims to win the game in explosive fashion before the opponent can respond.

The deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive creatures like Thalia to quickly pressure the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thalia to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck has a strong mana base and utilizes cards like Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull. It also includes utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas to disrupt the opponent's mana base and protect key creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while also utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker. The deck can quickly put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp, backed up by equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull. The deck also has a toolbox element with Recruiter of the Guard to search for specific answers. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence and applying pressure.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures like Hogaak, Vengevine, and Bloodghast to create explosive combo plays. Utilizing cards like Hedron Crab, Stitcher's Supplier, and Altar of Dementia to mill cards and trigger various effects, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and graveyard recursion. Cabal Therapy provides disruption, while Bridge from Below synergizes with sacrificing creatures to create an army of Zombies. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to execute its game plan efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Lotus Petal to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield quickly. The deck also includes plenty of card draw and counterspells like Ponder, Force of Will, and Daze to help protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The use of efficient mana sources like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors allow the deck to ramp into its big threats early and consistently.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of control elements, efficient removal spells, and card advantage through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Sylvan Library. It also includes strong threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Oko, Thief of Crowns to pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's colors and maximize the use of snow-covered lands for additional synergy. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own board presence and card advantage to secure victory.

The key concept of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to efficiently and aggressively control the board while keeping up pressure on the opponent. This is achieved through a combination of low-cost spells like Chain Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Pyroblast, supported by efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck also includes counterspells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes cantrips like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to ensure consistent card selection and maintain tempo. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and dual lands to support the deck's color requirements and to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland.

The main focus of this Bant Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and controlling the board. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Narset, Teferi, and Oko, along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game. Cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Ice-Fang Coatl provide additional value and card draw, ensuring that the pilot of this deck can outlast their opponents and emerge victorious through careful decision making and resource management.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while quickly building up a board presence through creatures with enter-the-battlefield effects. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, the deck can keep up with fast-paced opponents while controlling the game with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. The creatures in the deck provide value through their abilities, such as bouncing problematic permanents or locking down the opponent's board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of disruption, card advantage, and creature synergy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board by using cards like Swords to Plowshares and Trinisphere while generating value through the use of Life from the Loam and Green Sun's Zenith to fetch key creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Primeval Titan. The deck also aims to create a strong mana base with cards like Mox Diamond and Ancient Tomb while utilizing lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to quickly create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also has access to utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Blast Zone to disrupt opponent's strategies.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. By utilizing a mix of versatile cards like Force of Will and Brainstorm, along with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own board presence. With a solid mana base and access to powerful sideboard options thanks to Yorion, Sky Nomad, this deck is well-equipped to handle a variety of threats and strategies in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Doomsday as the primary win condition. By carefully stacking the top of the library with key cards using cantrips like Ponder and Preordain, the player can set up a game-winning combo involving Thassa's Oracle. Utilizing cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, the deck also includes various disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. Overall, the key strategy is to efficiently set up and execute the Doomsday combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful tempo plays and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. By combining disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle with threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Oko, Thief of Crowns, the deck aims to control the game while dealing damage quickly. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the inclusion of cards like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning provide additional reach to close out games. Overall, this deck aims to be aggressive and proactive in disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently dump powerful creatures like Griselbrand into the graveyard using cards like Faithless Looting and Entomb, then reanimate them onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The use of Chancellor of the Annex and other disruptive cards helps protect the combo by slowing down the opponent. The deck aims to quickly set up a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with creatures that they may struggle to deal with, ultimately leading to a victory through attacking or alternate win conditions like Tendrils of Agony.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes cards such as Crop Rotation, Elvish Reclaimer, and Into the North to tutor for the combo pieces quickly. Thoughtseize, Duress, and Inquisition of Kozilek are included to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library provide card advantage. The deck also includes ramp cards like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal to speed up the combo potential. Additionally, cards like Pithing Needle and Karakas provide additional protection and disruption.
